content.description: Start WAY right on the right mound of rock, on a ledge, with dark colored rock. It is better than it looks.
Climb the arete. Crimps, sidepulls, and underclings will be key!
content.location:
It is to the right of '

For the Money

"' on the left separate tower.

content.description:
Solid Copy is the second route from the right. It shares anchors with

Transmitter Trader

and has 10 bolts. Start up steep rock on big jugs. Find a bit of face climbing, a mini-tower, a layback, flaring crack, then finish on edges. This has a bit of everything.
content.location:
It is North of

Transmitter Trader

on a ledge to the right of the base area.

content.description: Robocall is a beautiful, moderate, arete line with 7 bolts and Fixe ring anchors.
content.location:
It is the farthest north route on the main wall just left

Auto Smiler

. Start up a boulder, and transition onto the main wall.

content.description: This is the steep bolted line next to an unprotectable crack on the right wall.  The rock is a little dirty which makes the crux more exciting.
content.location: On the right wall, it is the obvious lichenous crack.

content.description:
Start the same as

Analog or Digital

, then head right and clip 7 bolts and 2 rap rings atop.
content.protection: ~7 draws to two cold shut anchor bolts.
content.location: This is on the right side of the left outcropping.

content.description: This is an 8 bolt line (black hangers) that heads up the arete on the right bulge at Transmitter. The 5.9 start is about 3 feet to the left of the first bolt (direct start is 5.11ish). The crux is just after the 2nd bolt (might be a move or two of 10a). The rest of the route fun, steep 5.8 on jugs and edges.
content.protection: There are Fixe rings on top.
content.location:
It is on the right part of the wall between

Quick Lick

and

Solid Copy

.

content.description: This climbs the left side of the first wall you come to. It is long, and it protected by 7 bolts to 2 bolt anchor.
This is a fun, well-protected route that follows an overhanging finger crack through a roof into some mellow slab climbing to the anchors. The crux is between third and fourth bolts.
content.location: To the left of the main wall, there is a separate "tower" with 2 bolted lines. For the Money is the striking line on the left.

content.description:
Cranck Call is a long gear route on the center of the wall that ends at the same anchors of

Transmitter Trader

.
content.location: It is in the middle of the right mound and goes up a crack.

content.description: This is one of the best, if not the best route, in Buena Vista.  The rock quality is beautiful. Start under a bulge, and pull up into a face climbing mecca of crimps, and ledges.
content.location: This is the second leftmost route on the left mound of rock.

content.description: This is a sustained, fun, footwork-intensive slab climb. Start left of the hollowed-out water chute, step over, and brush aside an annoying prickly bush that conceals a key foothold. Cross over the top of the water chute, and work up a balancy flake. Cross back over left as the flake fades, and commit to the thin face around the middle to bottom of the upper third of the route. Negotiate the short crux with a tricky clip and a precise foothold exchange. The rock is splotched with bright multicolored splashes of lichen that give it an eye-baffling quality that makes the smallish footholds hard to see. The route eases toward the top but is still engaging with some positive underclings. There is a cool view over the top!
content.location:
After climbing

Free Roaming

(which is essentially the first pitch of this route), walk left up the gully to the base of

CJP

. The belayer will probably have climbers going up the highly popular route

I Can Hear You Now!

just to their left.

content.description: Auto Smiler is the least-most impressive route, though it is still good. This climbs the face right of the large crack.

Good quality route, same start as

I Can Hear You Now

, but then break left after a couple bolts.
content.location: Middle of the left mound of rock, starts right, ends in the middle.
